BnFnKAcy4XlSQjGg0QIN3w.text: Beware the syrup! Stopped in here because I had a hankering for some french toast early one sunday morning. The service was fast, sometimes too fast. (My waitress asked me if I was ready to order about 15 seconds after I was seated and brought the bill with my feel which made me feel rushed.) For some bizarre reason they have implemented a system where the chef calls out over the loudspeaker to let the waitresses know when the food is ready which does not make for a pleasant environment to enjoy breakfast. At all. So finally my french toast arrives and I prepare to dig in. I read the top of the syrup closest to me which says "old fashioned" oh yea that's how I like it. I notice that this syrup has a purple tint to it. Definitely not old fashioned. I called the waitress over to let her know that I don't eat that kind of syrup and now my french toast is ruined bug assured her I at least tried to do the right thing by reading the top where it said old fashioned. She said "oh they all usually say the same thing." um...what is the point of that? She brought me out some new french toast likety split and I tested out the syrup before I went in for the big pour this time. Overall food was good, this guy yelling in my ear the duration of my breakfast was not.

yB6NKjavAnrLgNVzev43bg.text: As a restaurant owner never had An experienced such horrible service and cold food!!! Bruha manager said I had to pay for a meal that was cold and not correct!  I did eat because I was starving but left 1/3 of to show them!  Never will I go to an ihop again!  No stars for this place rude untrained and very disrespectful!  No wonder this place has a 2 star rating!!!!

69dPNT41fFXJhQFfEj7pYA.text: waffles (with apple cinnamon), sausage, grits, toast, orange juice 3x times out the week... love it!! customer service so nice they mde sure to ask if u was being helped, very organized, clean also! took 13mins to make food! love it!

tEd4EPoRYQiqKLdBJ7wK3Q.text: If i could give them a half star i would.I will never return here..it was awful.server was rude. Manager was avoding me the only person that acted like they wanted to work was the bust boy.I spilled my juice it took someone 30mins to wipe up and that's only because the bust boy saw it walkn by I translated in spanishb to get manager and he did nothing about the waitress .didn't comp me a drink or anything.I ased for syrup and hot sauce by time I got it I was ready to go

photos.caption: Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States. All I ordered was fruit turkey sausage hashbrown n toast.. 1 grape.didn&#39;t get jelly and tabso sauce til my toast cold

s-QvOVU2zOzOuycZzUgBcg.text: I've been to this IHOP many many times with pretty good service. The most recent visit (tonight) literally left a bad taste in my mouth.  It started with a less than attentive waitress, progressed to a dirty teaspoon, and ended with batter-filled undercooked pancakes (that arrived about 10 minutes after the other part of my meal).  I asked for a manager. The woman who came over asked the problem, I told her and asked her to comp the pancakes. (They were part of the double blueberry pancake combo.)  She apologized several times then left the table.  When our waitress brought the bill, she said the manager had taken $5 off the bill.   We were comped our drinks (one cup of hot tea and the all-you-can-drink soda). I wasn't aware those two drinks were $5, but okay...  Kudos to the seasoned waitress, Iris, who tried her best to rectify our situation.  Actually I happen to be a French toast fan but c'mon IHOP! If you can't do pancakes, well, what CAN ya do?

l1aeOLUzBaOT2Fnl8CSo8g.text: Very slow. Ordered a mushroom cheese omelet and it had no mushrooms! Waitress says, "we're out of mushrooms." What? Don't tell me, just deliver it WITHOUT A MAJOR INGREDIENT. Coworker had chocolate chip pancakes; same thing; delivered even though out of chocolate sauce. How about checking with us first? Idiots.

6avQ6R22vUGjzIMt6X1gOQ.text: Ok, I'm going to give this 4 stars only because the service is usually pretty good here, a notch or 2 above Denny's at Concord Mills and actually better than the IHOP in Matthews, so kudos to the managers at this location as well as the staff. This is what it is, a breakfast place, not the Taj Mahal. I try to base my reviews on what a store or restaurant actually is , and not compare an IHOP to the Brown Derby.  The food is consist ant and is my mothers fave place to meet my wife and I for breakfast. I only wish they offered omelet without the added pancake batter, it does make for a fluffy omelets, but my wife has gluten issues, and this severely limits her menu choices.  Try to arrive no later than about 8:30 unless you like waiting on a table.  Also the last few visits the Wi-Fi was down for some reason

3N0wZK_Dzt-hBdOGMqCT9Q.text: A good solid breakfast. Service is always on the spot and food is pretty good but not spectacular. They have Cholula hot sauce, which is a necessity with this type of food.  This place jams on Sundays; it seems that if you are not here by 8:30 you are waiting outside with the crowds.   I would eat here more; but can't eat gluten and everything here comes with pancakes. Yes, I know it the IHOP, but is it too much to ask for more than one option with out the flapjacks? They even add batter to the omelets. Pity too; there are more options for me at Denny's,  but the food here is better.

ZNyWR5uL7CT9YTtyrG7ePw.text: Nice staff but I feel like I'm being squeezed  into a little box very small restaurant for the amount of traffic

x9g9jBBGAjMD_y0-_ufOvg.text: Our servicer Marika (sp) was fantastic. Wonderful service, great food.  We were all very hungry after an exciting day. Every plate was clean when we were ready to leave. We'll come back here for Breakfast.

3dzUGAaE8b7y7sK0wXt2Sg.text: It is an IHOP. the food is fast, hot and great for a hangover. The day I went they were packed but everything was still good.

u2o31b0jnJ25iMnh6Ye3uw.text: We were greeted and seated as soon as we walked in. We must have beat the Saturday morning rush. My son had a ham and cheese omelet with 3 pancakes he said it was good. I had a T-bone steak, scrambled eggs and cheese, 3 pancakes, milk, and grapefruit juice. My steak was really good and cooked just how I asked for it. Everything was good. Our waitress was very attentive, courteous, professional, and great.

_knbiHjabsH8nd6BFnBoiw.text: Stopped in for a quick breakfast Friday morning while my wife and I were running errands. It was a lot more crowded than I thought it would be. No problem, we were in no hurry. We were told about a 15 min wait. It took 30.  Once we were seated, we were greeted by our waitress quickly. She was very nice, and definitely knew what she was doing. The positive for this visit stops there.  We both had quick 2 egg, with bacon, hash browns, and toast. Also a carafe of OJ. The OJ was great! Both our eggs came out way undercooked. The bacon was way, way, overcooked. "Hashbrowns" were raw. Our toast had some sort of nasty spray oil/butter on it that just ruined plain white toast. (didn't know you could do that)  Then while waiting to pay with our credit card on the table, we sat for almost 20 minutes before our waitress returned for the check. Again it was busy, she was double sat, no big deal. Except that the "manager" walked by our table 3 times and couldn't be bothered to pick up our check and run it. He instead was sitting with what looked like some old buddies BS'ing while everyone else ran around like chickens with their heads cut off.  No thanks, I won't be back.

5DGEdf6vZz1Oa_z5mNSh6A.text: It was a long wait for breakfast and club sandwich....but when the food did come out the hashbrowns looked like they had not been on the grill at all?  They fixed it slowly upon request.

xS3HHB9EKyI17yfMShZZig.text: Server was not very friendly, seemed like a lot of staff was hanging around but not doing much. No one was even @ the register.  Will not be going to this location again. Huntersville has much friendlier staff.

tJwrtqqnxldjrF57MYlVcA.text: Fast friendly service. Food is ok. But the pancakes are to die for. My kids love them. Sunday is very busy. Got to get in early!

ezU6NjC-fMQ978ci1BoOFA.text: My experience was the antithesis of Bill M.'s. They sat me immediately, took my drinks order, and gave me some alone-time with the menu. Very smooth.  My server, Courtney, was wonderful. Definitely one of the nicest waitresses I have had in Charlotte, including upscale fancypants dinner restaurants. The food was equally good. I expect you know what you are getting at IHOP, and they didn't screw up their standard fare. So that's great.  If it weren't so bad for me, I'd be back soon.

5kXm7uwI0WKUr6GAeYFlIw.text: I will never return to the place. Service was very slow. My sons food was under cooked, coffee sucked and on top the that the place smelled like BO/toilet.

8VQBcN2nGmpYdFFGJsz1jg.text: Service was decent for an IHOP. Meal was delivered quickly and was pretty tasty. What more can you ask for from an IHOP?

R3Ug59vDiXyLlQt_G_GPtA.text: Waited 19 minutes for takeout order of bacon, pancakes, eggs and cup of juice. The juice was not added to my ticket. Was told to pay for juice if I wanted it and was forced to wait an additional 9 minutes for it. Not the best customer service. No sense of urgency or empathy for the inconvenience.

uPBMxzmtfWFoFNqstTLE0Q.text: I recently visited this location of IHOP for lunch with a friend since we were craving for omelet. The location was busy but we were able to get a table right away.   Our server came right away so we ordered our drinks. I guess it was our lucky day, our drinks arrived in no time yay. My sweet tea was missing lots ot love, I guess my server didn't get any from  We were on the clock since it was during the week so we picked out what we wanted and ordered our food quickly. She came back with our food in few minutes. I would say have had better omelet at other restaurants but it was OK rating wise.   The place wasn't clean enough and I think they can use a little uplift/renovation.

nI55UPv9_U62sSIjU8SN5g.text: We came in for dinner tonight at the 'ol IHOP. The food was the typical fare. What really made our experience five star was our server Angelo. He was attentive and patient with our special requests. He went out of his way to accommodate us.He had the most positive attitude. It was truly a refreshing experience as I have had some pretty crappy servers at this location before. He is a valuable asset to this location. Way to go Angelo!

2TKnHfq_YZOGpY9RTfToog.text: Very hospitable! This is my usual, neighborhood IHOP. Each time i am here, the wait staff go. Above and beyond to accommodate my party of 6+. Nice staff, clean restaurant, and quick service.

XwpJArGkKuRHx6HTNErKYA.text: I am so upset. I ordered the new toffee apple cheesecake pancakes and all I received was regular pancakes. This was a carry out order. When I called back, the lady advised me that everything was in the bag. Why would a customer lie about pancakes? This was an insult! Very unprofessional!!!! This is the second time that my order was messed up. Very disappointing!!!

TGTLhRpil3uwzp_-ykoOrA.text: Good service, not too busy Saturday morning.  Pretty new; not sure how long it's been open.  Standard IHOP fare. Parking out front is limited, but lot stretches on both sides.

3A3UxgcNsMliJrKV5cEvcQ.text: IHOP was great ! I had a a large order for pick up Angie patiently took my order and went over everything exactly how I ordered it

o74vtPZhEFpYqSCY_Gg-ZQ.text: I love ihop specially for breakfast and lunch and always the consistency is the same . It was very busy when we went . The only thing they need to work on is the staff they just need to be more attentive.

uSCCb2g4fjLf5a_i7SEyYw.text: I wish I could give this location no star at all. Was sat almost immediately in a nearly empty restaurant, then waited 20 minutes and no one came to take my order. I literally just walked out. Passed the host who sat me on my way out, no acknowledgement whatsoever. Way to bring in the New Year Ihop. I guess they're selective about who they serve in 2017.

viWRrNuniepLyCesoOkkxA.text: Haven't been to IHOP for a very long time because those closed to my house never impressed me.  But my friend wanted to go & we found this one.  First impression was clean.  Then there's a little crowd.  Then the pumpkin pancake turned me on.  Turkey instead of pork kept up my appetite.  Service was very good too.  Worth my time.  Good!

photos.caption: Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States

I21jTCYNMatMeSPyLt8yeg.text: I have been going to this particular IHOP location for years now, and one thing I have learned, is to get there early on the weekends if you want to avoid a wait.  So that is exactly what my gf and I did today, Sunday 12/11/11.  We arrived around 9:30am, we able to find parking without difficulty, and did not have to wait at all for a table!  After going through the standard preliminaries, being seated, placing drink orders, ordering our meals, etc, my gf and I were relieved when our food finally arrived due to our mutual hunger.  I ordered  the 3 egg breakfast, which included, four pieces of bacon, and three pancakes (I ordered the blueberry pancakes).  In addition, I ordered a side of hash browns, just to be certain that my hunger pain would be satisfied.  FOOD:   My gf and I ordered our eggs scrambled with cheese and they arrived to our mutual liking -hot and with plenty of cheese (see pics).  I thought my bacon was a bit under-cooked however.  2 of the pieces were cooked perfectly and two were definitely semi-raw.  I left one of my slices because I did not feel safe eating it.  The hash browns were standard.  They were good, but def not great, and in need of some salt and pepper.  The best part of our breakfast was the pancakes.  I ordered the blueberry pancakes, which were  "REAL and SPECTACULAR!" (see pics)  They were full of soft, juicy blueberries and the warm maple syrup set everything right off!  SERVICE: Our service was great.  Our server was polite, efficient and to the point.  She refiled our waters twice and all of our food arrived exactly as we had ordered it. We were able to get in and out within 40-50min.  I will say that when we left around 10:30, there was that line of people waiting in the door and standing outside in the cold waiting to be seated!  If you are thinking of going to this IHOP location, I recommend getting the bacon cooked well, as well as arriving early and to try one of their flavored pancakes.  I mean this place isn't called the International House of Pancakes for NOTHING!

photos.caption: Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lots of food!
Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States. The syrup options available @ IHOP
Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blueberry pancakes up close and personal

Z66AmvJrR-_8h0G2vFVrUA.text: IHOP manager is solely responsible for everything under there roof. Multiple tables open, full staff and there is a wait Really!  Two hosts standing when one could be busting tables. The manager has absolutely no clue how to run a restaurant.

nll82kwBGnNUTKYNl9QTVw.text: So I was excited to receive an email from IHOP yesterday that they were bringing the stuffed French toast back. So today I decided to order that meal to-go. I got the stuffed French toast with strawberries, hash browns, turkey sausage and cheese grits in stead of eggs. I get there and they gave me the donut French toast. I asked the lady that placed my order "what is this" and she proceeds with "well we don't have that stuffed French toast anymore so I assumed u wanted the donut one". Like WTF you don't assume what I want to eat. And the only reason I even started eating at IHOP again was bc they brought the stuffed French toast back. So her manager comes out and I guess he forgot to tell the staff that they are now serving the stuffed French toast again. He apologizes and takes the donut French toast back and 10mins later brings me a stuffed French toast. At this point I should have checked my order before leaving bc I get home and realize that they never gave me my cheese grits! Completely horrible!!! I'm so pissed!

lHjGDNX5pcwufqO39du56A.text: This entry needs to be deleted because this is a redundant business listing.  This is the same mildew stank IHOP.  Nothing is wrong with the waitstaff, they aren't stank.  This place needs to have the carpets replaced because they aren't doing well.  You keep thinking a homeless person is sleeping around the corner or that you are in a ruined cheap motel.  Mildew / urea are the smells I get.  I know the mildew is from the rugs.  The urea smell is probably from a cleaning agent.

xuqSvXkht3F8bz6Uw1Lt4A.text: It's IHOP, breakfast food fast and cheap...open 24 hours a day how can youo wrong?!?  I chose the Colorado omelet which really is a meat lovers dream! It's loaded with ham, bacon, sausage and pot roast! It comes with salsa on the side which adds a very nice flavor!   My food came out hot, and prepared just the way I ordered, these omelets are pretty big so be prepared to take half of it home!   The pancakes were fluffy and hot...I always ask for the hot syrup to go with them!   Just a note....Parking is horrible...the lot is always full! Other than that it was a good meal at a good price, so you will see me again IHOP!!!

8qCEKhKH6W40PJOLQ8Wh2Q.text: I haven't been to IHOP in a long time so we decided to go here one morning. The wait for 4 people wasn't too bad, about 25 minutes. Finally got to the table, we all ordered coffee/orange juice. Coffee wasn't that good, I only had a few sips from mine. I ordered the country omelet which had ham, cheese and hash-browns inside. It tasted pretty good, hot sauce made it taste better. I do wish I would have asked for some salsa to go with it to give it a little more flavor. My friend ordered an omelet and she had asked for no mushrooms and when hers came out...it had a lot of mushrooms inside. She decided to just pick them out instead of making a big deal about it. She didn't even finish half of it because she said it was too bland.

Bd51TCoV3GQ6V5StVhznFA.text: IHOP is the place for my unusual loaded baked potato soup fix of the day. It is my favorite item on their menu. But that aside it's not a particularly unique experience to go here. Yeah it's the International House of Pancakes but I have to say it's a name we spent lots more time pondering over hot Lipton's tea while waiting for our food to come out. Like, why is it international? Because the food isn't exactly international fare and I'm not aware of them being popular in foreign countries. In fact the most international thing about this IHOP is the multicultural staff and the university area patrons.  Yeah, they have some standard menu items I like but I can get a steak omelet at at least 100 other unique joints just in this city. Breakfast food is breakfast pretty much anywhere you go. It's impossible to screw up eggs. And they don't. Just like delicious pancakes with different toppings. The one thing you can rely on is boring consistency with a chain like IHOP so boring that you almost want them to burn your bacon to a crisp so that you have to complain to get some excitement with your meal. When I'm depressed and want to indulge in the comforts of a warm bowl of pureed potato soup I know I can always find IHOP there for me.

9yK3BAcV5_m-AdVHkIeiAA.text: Ordered upside down pineapple pancakes, tasted good.. Neatness of the restaurant was average as it was very busy.. Food arrived quickly..

gCAskJoioFO-agrmGZyfBQ.text: This IHOP tends to be both crowded and slow.  These don't work well together.  Aside from the service being friendly but the food coming slowly is the parking.  The parking is a disaster and I have almost been hit by a car while walking, hit by a car while parking, and hit by a car while just driving.  I really don't like how it forces all the traffic into a narrow U shaped parking area.  On the bright side while you are waiting or recovering from a near death experience you can peruse the used bookstore next to the IHOP.  This IHOP is about mid-range when it comes to how new and clean looking it is.  I have seen some fancy IHOP locations and some ones that look like they haven't been renovated since the 1970s.  This one looks to be about the middle of the pack.

g6Kyc0LER2k29FqgcRyOVg.text: TBH it's only my second or third time dining at an American restaurant. Glad it left a good impression on me. Pancakes are not bad but defo not that good, breakfast is typical so nothing special. Nice staff came to check up on us many times. A small but cheap tidy restaurant

dZtDhBorthaBDZJhY33NtA.text: Very short staffed which creates bad service. Very long waits after you order, especially waiting for order to be taken. Food is below average despite low prices. Our server did the best she could despite being a very busy day. Management is not very involved except to check out every woman that walked in.

iOF0REC0tglcRa9KSQdmdA.text: Service was mediocre. I ordered unlimited pancakes and individual potatoes. Never received potatoes had to wait ten mins before waiter seen I needed more pancakes. 4pm not a busy hour.  I'm really being nice by giving 3 stars

84V-QZoBlelqxgoAwu8Nhw.text: The restaurant was clean, the food was good, and our server, Idris was polite and attentive. Great service!

2l1EPNaM--kvswjuu-omqA.text: As we approached the IHOP we saw the line coming out if the door. I thought it would be a long wait but to my surprise we waited under 5 minutes.   Our server was prompt and our food came out quickly. My son was ready to run for the door because these weird sayings kept coming over the loud speaker. My son was very paranoid but I didnt pay it no mind. I actually thought it was hilarious.  Once we got home my son lookedup IHOP because he wanted to know about the weird sayings. Actually for the month of October in honor of Halloween  they are trying to scare the customers.   Overall our experience was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States

WBFLZOS14eKHv5FrWx9ljg.text: It's been quite awhile since I've been to an IHOP but after leaving the Hornets game, my brother wanted to stop in. After looking at some of the reviews i was hesitant but long story short, i'm glad we went.   Our food was cooked perfectly, our server Destiny was AWESOME, and there was not a very long wait for our meals. Great job, guys!

Q5r5UTVKbrgS9m2NrirE0g.text: We wanted breakfast for lunch and decided on ihop as it was one of the only restaurant that serves breakfast later in the day. On the menu there are so many choices of breakfast foods. I ordered a spicy poblano omelette with a side of the strawberry pancakes. The food was cold but the presentation was not so good(hence I didn't ya a picture). The service was not great but not horrible, we did have to ask for silverware as we didn't have any on the table. I really enjoy coming to ihop but I feel that it really is a bit or miss at this place.

3NiTzlZbgeIVj2o-6PjWng.text: I don't know where to begin!!  It should have begun w us leaving the moment I went to the restroom before being seated, and saw the filthy surroundings.  Bathroom was dirty, but the floor in the main dining room was disgusting. I had to walk by the kitchen to get to my seat, and the floor was so black from dirt, and around our booth so gross.  My husband had already ordered a Coke.  So he said let's ask what the sanitation score is, the girl said, 98.  So I asked her why the place was so filthy, when there was only one other table seated, and 3 servers standing around. Of course, she said, I'm sorry about that.   It was such a fiasco, it was a rainy night and no one was there, the other table got their food and I Overheard them complaining about how long it took. It was our own stupidity that we stayed, they have a new cook and didn't know how to make anything!  They didn't even have mashed potatoes, they said the person that makes those had already went home. I ordered the chicken fried steak and ended up getting french fries with it. I was supposed to get a piece of Texas toast. It never came, when I asked about it, she went back and checked. The cook came out and said I don't know how to make that! It's a piece of toast! As we are getting ready to leave they brought me one lonely little piece of toast. It was the kind that is pre-buttered...   One of my Husband's close friends thanks IHOP is the best restaurant in the world! But said this is the worst one in town. I thought because it was newer and on my way home we'd give it a try.    Big mistake!!! Never again

photos.caption: Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States. Floor next to our booth. Whole place was filthy!

3NjIm7VmeX-urR_B4UQGUQ.text: So many flavors to choose from!! And every of them are good :D service is great, and price is fair! Enjoy a lot here!

photos.caption: Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mexican Tres pancake!
Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States. The grinch!

xqhAOaZIltVz9OmDs6vvUA.text: Stopped in for a quick breakfast while in town - our server, Angelo, was so friendly and very attentive.  Great smile and just great as his job!  We both ordered two egg plates with bacon, hash browns and wheat toast.  Eggs perfect, hash browns undercooked, bacon good, toast fine.  We ordered two really yummy orange juice fizzed drinks, free refills so we got two to go as well.   Okay breakfast overall, atmosphere friendly, restaurant and ladies room spotless.  This IHOP is in a nice little strip, not a free-standing building.    Would eat here again if in town.

photos.caption: Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two egg plate with hash browns and bacon
Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States

N1KGWSV6ztB2vCvzE2ynbA.text: We visited this location today during the Free Pancake day and was amazed how well they handled the crowd. Our server did a good job making sure everything was okay with our order, etc. We didn't have to wait a tremendous time for the food to arrive either. I didn't give 5 stars because usually the pancakes are fresher but I'm aware of the pancake request for today's deal.

photos.caption: Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States. I had the Colorado Omelette and it was delicious.

fkZhIyq8y_iBGmOp35xIag.text: I ordered from this location via postmates and received an incorrect order. I understand mistakes happen. My issue is that when we called to ask for the correct item the gentleman who answered was extremely rude. We paid $30 for ihop to be delivered to us and we waited 45 minutes, received 1 incorrect order and all of the food was cold. I understand postmates is also at fault and I have contacted them as well but the customer service of this establishment is extremely lacking. Very disappointing. I work at a hotel in the area and we would suggest this location to guests but I will be sure to tell our entire staff to no longer recommend this restaurant as the food is terrible quality and the staff is rude.

4hiRnij2baq2xIw8B0o7eQ.text: Went to Celebrate a graduation with some friends. The waiter was nice but the food was terrible. The pancakes had batter still in them. My eggs and bacon were cold. The coffee was burnt. I didnt want to be rude to the waitor. I asked to talk to the manager and she came over. He looked at us while we were telling her about being disatisfied about the meals. She did not offer to have it remade and had us all pay in full price even tho we didnt eat any of it. She did not even apologize. She laughed at us and dissapeared. I get its busy on a Sunday but thats not right. Poor Poor celebration for my friend and a terrible experience this morning!

az9aMfXQWkE8psIFTHG3PQ.text: It's been awhile since I've been here the menu has changed quite a bit. I was sad to see my favorite red velvet pancakes not on the menu. They have a weekday deal for 5.99, so that's what I chose, meat, eggs, pancakes and hash browns. When you crave a little bit of waffle house hash browns, you can ask them to add ingredients and I chose diced jalapenos.

V1HLz8S60LST30aVQvUTHg.text: The service here is always great for me. After leaving another location due to poor service on a Thursday morning, we came to this location and were seated and had our meal in a very timely manner. The food was tasty and we appreciated our server's friendly approachable attitude.

QTUQ0r_UtE0HwnyrFgy_wA.text: Food are really nice and our services was extremely good idris he really perfect and lovely hope see you again

Smh-r7IiqIFco9HtqCoLNA.text: I came on a weekday AM, not busy, about 10 servers standing around wiping down chairs.  The server we had seemed to have all the tables and no help.  The food was not so great, very greasy with a weird taste.  The service wasn't so good, not because the server was bad, but because she had no help, even though they were fully staffed.  Just not a place I would recommend, I'd rather go to McDonald's down the street honestly.

photos.caption: Photo of IHOP - Charlotte, NC, United States

7tgUt4xMTQ_QYwvJupZAPg.text: This IHOP's unprofessionalism from the "manager" Bobby Williams has caused all IHOPS as a whole to lose my business, regardless if it's a corporate or franchise. I felt he was unprepared, and it is MY RIGHT to voice my displeasure as I see fit as long as it's not derogatory or violent, so I told him as I walked out after he clearly showed he did not value my business, that he and his IHOP was unprepared and should have been better prepared. He immediately took offense, got smart with me, and told me to "get over it, places run out of stuff", I have managerial experience through several channels of retail and commission sales, that is not how you speak to a customer whether you're an employee or manager of a business!!! His job as manager, when someone says something you don't like or agree with, it's your duty to be professional about it by either by saying something along the lines of I'm sorry sir/miss you feel that way or just by not saying anything and letting it roll off your shoulders. Mind you I was walking out the door, so that triggered me, I came back in after he called me out, we argued about his lack of being prepared as he continued to use his excuse of running out of stuff. At this point I was highly irate, and this was where I got uncivil, prior to this I never shouted or screamed at him or his staff/I did not use derogatory words or profanity/I did not threaten him or his staff with violent physical threats, all I did up to this point of arguing was displaying my dissatisfaction of how things were ran through an unprepared manager through a tone of voice that was a bit angry(not raging mad) and grumpy/dissatisfied, and that was my right to do so. Like I said at this point of arguing, I lost my composure, due to his lack of PROFESSIONALISM and wanting to argue with me as a "manager", I snapped and told him twice to F him, I proceeded to walk out in rage, he decided he wanted to be smart some more and purposely said in a volume loud enough so I could hear as I was walking out the doors yet again "yea you're all talk, that's why you walk". Again that is not how a True manager of a workplace acts. We argued yet again, I told that a True manager doesn't act the way he acted, that a manager doesn't act like he's from the hood. Once again I go to walk out, as I am doing so he then retaliates with a cocky thuggish attitude, "yea I am hood". That causes me to finally go into overdrive with my irateness and anger, I got extremely loud to where customers noticed, I told him "see that's what I'm talking about, a True manager does not act that way and says stuff like that to customers", he scoffs some more and talks more trash talk to me. So I finally tell him in rage that I wanted his name because I was going to immediately call IHOP corporate and report him to them and have him fired for speaking to me the way he did as that is not the way to talk to a customer ever, his response was a cocky one he goes "fine give em my name, it's the name on my shirt" he then immediately points to his name on his shirt with both of his index fingers with force as he stares me down with anger. I have a high respect for the word and position of MANAGER through my experiences as one and my teachings from mentors in my experiences, I highly felt he disrespected that role and title tremendously, so I made sure to let him know that he was from my perspective was undeserving of that position, that he brought both disgrace and shame to the managerial role, and that he was no manager whatsoever by the standards of what it is to be a manager. I then contacted corporate immediately in my car outside in the parking lot, they told me they would contact the owner of the franchise about the matter and have someone from that franchise to contact me by Monday to resolve the issue of the unprofessional manager. No one ever did contact me, so I called corporate Tuesday, gave them my case number, the girl on the phone from corporate informed me that the owner told corporate that they refuse to contact me in an effort to resolve the issue with me stating to them I was "combative", though it was the "manager" who retaliated first when I simply told him what I thought about his lack of preparation, which his FIRST retaliation triggered the start of a long drawn out war of words, which his further retaliations would just keep adding fuel to the fire as he knew I'd wouldn't simply let them go unchecked. Obviously the owner doesn't care about me, my business, my money, or resolving the issue that is still present. This IHOP is a bad reflection on IHOP as a whole, as a COMPANY, and as a BRAND!!!

83vnlsK2-D0-wN8cYfTO5Q.text: Our server has been with IHOP for 22 years and did cool cup tricks! Best service ever. Wish I could remember his name!

DhcqD5dkEUjVT2FrQ7JAFw.text: I just got finished eating here and it was the worst experiences I've ever had at a restaurant. We got there and waited 45 minutes for our food the only reason that makes sense about the wait is they did have a big party which is completely understandable. After waiting 45 minutes they told my grandma they ran out of her food. They had not told us this until after we waited 45 minutes. Me and my sister and my dad ate and my grandma and grandpa walked away. We did not get any refills at all the whole time and had to ask for silverware about four times. Our waiter provided terrible service. The kids meals where supposed to be free but they charged us for it because there wasn't enough adults there. There was one single girl in there that was extremely nice so if you go there for whatever reason ask for her I don't know her name but she is African American with long eyelashes (they may be fake or extensions) and she has black hair and a skinny form. She was the only person that attempted to make the situation less crazy.

6rKXeTA3hhr8RIm-PEvz7g.text: I came in the store wanting to buy a gift card. I was inform that you can ONLY get a gift card with cash. I asked why and the manager said that someone came in there with a stolen cerdit card and got a $1,000 gift card. He shift manager called the GM and the GM said I could only get a gift card if they could take a copy of my ID and Credit card. Why is that? That's to much person information. I HAD MY ID!! THATS NOT MY FAULT THE EMPLOYEE LET SOMEONE BUY A $1, 000 GIFT CARD WITH A CREDIT CARD WITHOUT CHECKING THE ID!!! And for the GM, who know all about credit card fraud asking me for a copy of my card and ID in order to buy a gift card is unacceptable!!!!! The GM name is Bobby Williams WHAT STORE OR RESTAURANT DOES THAT!! BTW I ONLY WANTED A DANG ON $20 gift card! I could even see if I was trying to get the gift card and NO ID ... BUT I HAD MY ID

Ka628lnLFKnCRcCf_r1GrQ.text: Undercooked food, wrong orders, and now liars all within 2 visits? Can't be...  Yes it can. IHOP off of WT Harris was able to accomplish that:  My friend and I went into IHOP one day after working out and ordered the egg white omelet with shelled eggs and add steak. First order they did not use shelled eggs and the steak was undercooked. 2nd order, I'm thinking maybe they got this one right; wrong! They used shelled eggs but forgot to add steak. (How did you forget the steak?) Then our fruit was spoiled. I spoke with the manager, they finally got the orders right. At this point, my lady friend was so exasperated that she did not want the food. They didn't charge us for her food of course due to her barely touching it. The manager was very nice and I'm more of an easy going person I'd like to think, so I gave them the benefit of the doubt. He told me hey, I'm sorry that you had such a bad experience. I told him how great the service was (New girl who hasn't been acclimated to the typical soulless dry service that we've experienced but hey it's not like we're at Ruth Cris so I get it, although I have been to some exceptionally well customer service oriented IHOPS) In the attempt to gain in the middle of a negative situation, the manager said hey, I'll give you $5 off your next meal if you take the survey. Just tell them our agreement. I said okay, left the waitress a tip which consists of her normal %20 and added the additional $10 for my lady friends meal that she did not eat. It wasn't her fault the kitchen guys couldn't get it right. So today I go back to IHOP and order to go. I explain to the lady what happened and the managers promise and this manager would not honor it at all. I said ma'am how would I have known about your survey if you all didn't direct me to take it in exchange for a $5 credit. I said ma'am it's $5. I wouldn't have cared if I hadn't already held up my part of the bargain. She repeated with persistence I'm sorry over and over again as if she didn't hear one concern that departed my lips. It was the principal of having a bad experience only to be lied to, after giving them a good review based on a deceitful promise. I now question the integrity of this branch even more.

xbQNhyfjCJ8Oj6nS4LjmGQ.text: If you like. Cold sausage, cold eggs, and hash whites rather than hash browns....this is the place for you.  This is getting to be the signature of I hops they used to be great.
